                                Gathering data

- This will read all the experiments in different datatable and get spot intensity distribution
- Data for rab7a and slc2a1 , rpap3 and sec16a was imaged form the same plate but in two experiment files as the plate orientation was flipped in the initial imaging

```{r}
pat<- "*Spots 488*"

paths_Slc2a1 <- dir (path = "Data/Slc2a1/", pattern = pat, full.names = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) 
names(paths_Slc2a1) <- basename(paths_Slc2a1)
total.data_Slc2a1 <-ldply (paths_Slc2a1, fread , sep = "\t")
intensity.data_Slc2a1 <- total.data_Slc2a1[c("WellName", "Spots 488 - Corrected Spot Intensity")]
setnames(intensity.data_Slc2a1,"Spots 488 - Corrected Spot Intensity" , "Intensity" )
```

- Calculating the mean , SD and Int for all and combining them all in one file  



```{r}
Int_Errfi1 <- intensity.data_Errfi1 %>% 
  as_tibble%>% 
  group_by(WellName)%>% filter( Intensity < quantile(Intensity, 0.99) & Intensity > quantile(Intensity, 0.01))%>%dplyr:::summarize ( Mean_Errfi1 = mean (Intensity), SD_Errfi1 = sd(Intensity))%>% dplyr:::mutate(Int_Errfi1 = SD_Errfi1*SD_Errfi1/Mean_Errfi1)


Int_Canx <- intensity.data_Canx %>% 
  as_tibble%>% 
  group_by(WellName)%>% filter( Intensity < quantile(Intensity, 0.99) & Intensity > quantile(Intensity, 0.01))%>%dplyr:::summarize ( Mean_Canx = mean (Intensity), SD_Canx = sd(Intensity))%>% dplyr:::mutate(Int_Canx = SD_Canx*SD_Canx/Mean_Canx)

# combing the flipped and non flipped data. This is mostly for the non flipped data processing later 1. Combining the data. 2. Renaming the Int Columns and selecting the Int Columns

 
 Int_Combined_by_wellname <- Int_Canx%>%
  full_join(Int_egfr, by = "WellName")%>%
  full_join(Int_Errfi1, by = "WellName")%>%
  full_join(Int_GAPDH, by = "WellName")%>%

  full_join(Int_Myc, by = "WellName")%>%

  full_join(Int_Sec16a, by = "WellName")%>%
```

Take the mean of the intensity

```{r}
Two_column_Mean_combined<- Mean_Combined_by_wellname%>%select(WellName, contains("Mean")) %>% dplyr:::rename (Canx= Mean_Canx,
                                                                      Errfi1=Mean_Errfi1,
                                                                      Egfr=Mean_egfr,
                                                                      Gapdh=Mean_GAPDH,
                                                                      Kpnb1=Mean_Kpnb1,
                                                                      Myc=Mean_Myc,
                                                                      P53=Mean_P53,
                                                                      Rab7a=Mean_Rab7a,
                                                                      Rpap3_left_over=Mean_Rpap3_left_over,
                                                                      Sec16a_left_over=Mean_Sec16a_left_over,
                                                                      Rab7a_left_over=Mean_Rab7a_left_over,
                                                                      Slc2a1_left_over=Mean_Slc2a1_left_over,
                                                                      RhoA=Mean_RhoA,
                                                                      Sec16a=Mean_Sec16a,
                                                                      NRAS = Mean_nras,
                                                                      Dnajc5=Mean_Dnajc5,
                                                                      Slc2a1=Mean_Slc2a1,
                                                                      Rpap3=Mean_Rpap3)


colnames(Two_column_Mean_combined)

Non_flipped_Mean12<-Two_column_Mean_combined[c(1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,13,15,16)]
```



Correcting the well names for the genes Rab7a, Slc2a1, Rpap3 and Sec16a
a. Use the mean frequency file of above genes to join with  "wellnames", which were actually flipped
b. Rename the fliped well names to correct "Wellnames" (the actual correct orientation wellnames) and join rest of imaging  the "left over" 
c. Combine data for all the genes

```{r}




template<- read.csv(file = "Metadata/Orginal_Flipped.csv")

Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped <- template%>%full_join(Int_Rab7a, by = "WellName")%>%
full_join(Int_Slc2a1, by = "WellName")%>%
full_join(Int_Sec16a, by = "WellName")%>%
full_join(Int_Rpap3, by = "WellName")



colnames(Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped)[c(1:2)]<-c("Original", "WellName")
 

 Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all<- Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped %>%
   full_join(Int_Rab7a_left_over, by = "WellName")%>%
   full_join(Int_Sec16a_left_over, by = "WellName")%>%
   full_join(Int_Rpap3_left_over, by = "WellName")%>%
   full_join(Int_Slc2a1_left_over, by = "WellName")%>%select(c(1:2),contains("Mean") )
 
colnames(Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all)
 
 
Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all<- Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all%>%
  mutate(Rab7s_final= rowMeans((.[,c(3,7)]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
   mutate(Slc2a1_final= rowMeans((.[,c(4,10)]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
   mutate(Sec16a_final= rowMeans((.[,c(5,8)]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
   mutate(Rpap3_final= rowMeans((.[,c(6,9)]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  select(c(1:2),contains("Final") )
colnames(Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all)[c(3:6)]<-c ("Rab7a", "Slc2a1", "Sec16a", "Rpap3")
Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all<-Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all[c(-1)]

# joining flipped and non flipped

Full_Mean<- Non_flipped_Mean12%>% full_join(Mean_Combined_by_wellname_flipped_all, by = "WellName")


write.csv(Full_Mean, "Output/Collated_Int_HBEC_raw_unfiltered.csv", row.names = FALSE)

sum(is.na(Full_Mean))

```

Checking for outliars 

                 
```{r}


Full_Mean_b<- read.csv(file = "Output/Collated_Int_HBEC_raw_unfiltered.csv")

sum(is.na(Full_Mean_b))


Full_Mean_pivot_b<-pivot_longer(Full_Mean_b, c(2:15), names_to = "Genes", values_to = "Mean")%>%na.omit
ggplot(Full_Mean_pivot_b, aes(y=Mean, color=Genes)) + geom_boxplot()


HBEC_Mean_Stat_before<- Full_Mean_pivot_b%>%group_by(Genes)%>%dplyr:::summarize(    
                                                         median = median(Mean), 
                                                         high = quantile(Mean, 0.75)+ 5*(quantile(Mean, 0.75)- quantile(Mean, 0.25 )),
                                                         nintynine= quantile(Mean, 0.95),
                                                         five= quantile(Mean, 0.05),
                                                         max= max(Mean), min = min(Mean), 
                                                         low = quantile(Mean, 0.25)- 5*(quantile(Mean, 0.75)- quantile(Mean, 0.25 )),
                                                          mean= mean(Mean) )
# converting the number to NA where the value are 3 times more than the media, use the rannge obatined above 244 gapdh

Full_Mean<- Full_Mean_b%>%
  mutate(NRAS = ifelse(NRAS>122, NA,NRAS ))%>%
    mutate(P53 = ifelse(P53>135, NA,P53 ))%>%
   mutate(Rab7a = ifelse(Rab7a>271, NA,Rab7a ))%>%
  mutate(Sec16a = ifelse(Sec16a>135, NA,Sec16a ))
   

sum(is.na(Full_Mean))
 
  
  Full_Mean<-Full_Mean%>%select(c("WellName" ,"Canx", "Dnajc5" , "Egfr" , "Errfi1",  "Gapdh" , "Kpnb1", "Myc" ,  "NRAS" ,"P53"  ,    "Rab7a" , "Rpap3"  , "RhoA"   ,  "Sec16a"   ,      "Slc2a1"   ))
  colnames(Full_Mean)[c(9)]<-"Nras"
  
  
 HBEC_Mean_Stat_after<-Full_Mean_pivot%>%group_by(Genes)%>%dplyr:::summarize(    
                                                         median = median(Mean), 
                                                         high = quantile(Mean, 0.75)+ 5*(quantile(Mean, 0.75)- quantile(Mean, 0.25 )),max= max(Mean),
                                                         nintynine= quantile(Mean, 0.95),
                                                         five= quantile(Mean, 0.05),
                                                          min = min(Mean), 
                                                         low = quantile(Mean, 0.25)- 5*(quantile(Mean, 0.75)- quantile(Mean, 0.25 )),
                                                          Mean= mean(Mean) )
  
  
  

  
  
# rearranging
  
 
  colnames(Full_Mean) 


#Full_Int_pivot<-Full_Int[c(-1)]# to chek the spread before and after the filteration
Full_Mean_pivot<-pivot_longer(Full_Mean, c(2:15), names_to = "Genes", values_to = "Mean")%>%na.omit
ggplot(Full_Mean_pivot, aes(y=Mean, color=Genes)) + geom_boxplot()


HBEC_Mean_Stat_bf <- cbind(HBEC_Mean_Stat_before, HBEC_Mean_Stat_after)

write.csv(HBEC_Mean_Stat_bf, "Output/HBEC_Int_Stat_beforeAndAfter.csv")
```

```{r}
#### Reading the Replicates and Untreated well names for fishinmg out Interogeneity

Replicate1<- read.csv(file = 'Metadata/Replicate1.csv')
Replicate2<- read.csv(file = 'Metadata/Replicate2.csv')
Untreated<- read.csv(file = 'Metadata/Untreated.csv')

##### Exporting the replicate and untreated data

Replicate1_Data<-Replicate1%>%left_join(Full_Mean, by = "WellName")
Replicate2_Data<-Replicate2%>%left_join(Full_Mean, by = "WellName")
Untreated_Data<-Untreated%>%left_join(Full_Mean, by = "WellName")


 
write.csv(Untreated_Data, "Output/HBEC_Int_Untreated.csv", row.names=FALSE)



### printing the Int side by side

Side_By_side_HBEC<-cbind(Replicate1_Data[c(1,2)], Replicate2_Data[c(2,1)], 
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,3)], Replicate2_Data[c(3,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,4)], Replicate2_Data[c(4,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,5)], Replicate2_Data[c(5,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,6)], Replicate2_Data[c(6,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,7)], Replicate2_Data[c(7,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,8)], Replicate2_Data[c(8,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,9)], Replicate2_Data[c(9,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,10)], Replicate2_Data[c(10,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,11)], Replicate2_Data[c(11,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,12)], Replicate2_Data[c(12,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,13)], Replicate2_Data[c(13,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,14)], Replicate2_Data[c(14,1)],
            Replicate1_Data[c(1,15)], Replicate2_Data[c(15,1)]
            )
colnames(Side_By_side_HBEC)
# getting the values of the Int
replicates_M<-Side_By_side_HBEC[c(1,4,2,3,6,7,10,11,14,15,18,19,22,23,26,27,30,31,34,35,38,39,42,43, 46,47, 50,51, 54,55)]
colnames(replicates_M)

#Taking the mean of replicates


replicates_average_M<-replicates_M%>%
  mutate(Canx_I = rowMeans((.[,3:4]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Dnajc5_I = rowMeans((.[,5:6]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Egfr_I = rowMeans((.[,7:8]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Errfi1_I = rowMeans((.[,9:10]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Gapdh_I = rowMeans((.[,11:12]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Kpnb1_I = rowMeans((.[,13:14]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Myc_I = rowMeans((.[,15:16]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
   mutate(Nras_I = rowMeans((.[,17:18]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(P53_I = rowMeans((.[,19:20]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Rab7a_I = rowMeans((.[,21:22]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Rpap3_I = rowMeans((.[,23:24]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(RhoA_I = rowMeans((.[,25:26]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Sec16a_I = rowMeans((.[,27:28]) ,na.rm=TRUE))%>%
  mutate(Slc2a1_I = rowMeans((.[,29:30]) ,na.rm=TRUE))
  
#subsetting the _I entries only
replicates_average_M<-replicates_average_M%>%select(c(1,2) , contains("_I", ignore.case = TRUE, vars = NULL) )  # change it to include Well name

colnames(replicates_average_M)




Mean_Untreated_Int<-colMeans(Untreated_Data[sapply(Untreated_Data, is.numeric)], na.rm = TRUE)

test<- Untreated_Data[sapply(Untreated_Data, is.numeric)]
Median_Untreated_Int<-apply(test,2,median,na.rm = TRUE)
SD_Untreated_Int<-apply(test,2,sd,na.rm = TRUE)
Mean_Untreated_Int
Median_Untreated_Int
SD_Untreated_Int
Untreated_Mean_Median_SD<- cbind(Mean_Untreated_Int,Median_Untreated_Int, SD_Untreated_Int )

Untreated_Mean_Median_SD<- as.data.frame(Untreated_Mean_Median_SD)
```

Generating frequency with Class columns


```{r}
data1 <- read.csv("Output/HBEC_Int.csv", comment.char="#")

#adding classes and ordering the data frame

class_compound<- read.csv("Metadata/Epi_Data_HBEC_Class.csv")
class_compound<-class_compound[c(1,2)] 
data1 <-data1%>% filter(!row_number() %in% c(22,98))    # removing the blank column separately 
class_compound <-class_compound%>% filter(!row_number() %in% c(22,98)) # removing the blank column separately 
data1<-cbind( class_compound,data1 ) # was not able to remoce row 22 and 98 after combining
 # removing the second reduntant compound column 19

data1<- data1[-c(19)]
colnames(data1)
sorted_class<-data1[with(data1, order(Class, Compound)),]
colnames(sorted_class)
write.csv(sorted_class, "Output/HBEC_Int_Class_Sorted_22_98-removed.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```

# keeping the NA, they wil be white on the plot

rownames(mat_data) <- rnames

col_breaks = c(seq(.001,0.75,length=100),  # for red
               seq(0.76,1.25,length=100),           # for yellow
               seq(1.26,2,length=100)             # for green
               )      # for black



heatmap.2(mat_data, 
           lhei = c(2,12),
           main = "HBEC_Int",
           margin=c(10,12),
          cexRow = .2,
           col= my_palette,
           breaks = col_breaks,
           trace = "none",
           dendrogram="none",
          density.info="none",
